revised_title: Quasi-Steady-State Assumption Applied to Enzyme Reactions with Diffusion
tldr: The authors extend the quasi-steady-state assumption (QSSA) to include enzyme-substrate reactions with diffusion. They analyze the enzyme suicide-substrate reaction and the Michaelis-Menten reaction, showing that the region where the QSSA holds depends on space and time. This study provides a more accurate analysis for a wide range of biochemically relevant problems.
